{"step_by_step_thinking": "Enamel lamellae are linear enamel defects that extend either from the dentinoenamel junction (DEJ) to the surface of the enamel, or vice versa. They are prominent linear enamel defects and should not be confused with enamel tufts or enamel spindles. Enamel lamellae are not an elevation on the outer surface of enamel (choice A), nor are they dentinal tubules in enamel (choice B). They also do not refer to the uniform arrangement of enamel rods (choice C) or enamel projections in dentin (choice D).", "answer_choice": "D. Enamel projection in dentin"}
